result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge.  To be paid out of up to 25% of prison funds. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
*Defendant does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one (1) year Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.  No contact with victims: Pick N Save located at 1818 W. National Ave. Milwaukee, WI.; Kenneth L., Justin O. and Carlos J.P.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Submit a  DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcial A Castro-Santiago

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.   

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 203 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims: Pick n Save located at 1818 W. National Ave, Milwaukee, WI., Kenneth L., Justin O. and Carlos JP
*Seek and maintain full time employment.  
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Court in trial.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  Any restitution will be determined at sentencing.  Defendant is remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel requests jury trial.   Case is adjourned for  final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 26.  Filed, signed Felony Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests Projected guilty plea date.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter from the defendant filed.

Attorney Awni M. Yasin in court, defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel received discovery and requests Scheduling conference.   Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-03-2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion Moton Requesting Evidentary hearing, Motion for reduction of Bail, and letter, ProSe received and filed. tk

Defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago in court with attorney Cynthia Herber.  Defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Cynthia Herber in court, Defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in trial.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIL FILE.

Defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago in court with attorney Cynthia Herber.  Defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago in custody.  Jeremy Arn for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kenneth L. or Pick N Save located at 1818 W. National Ave.

Defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Marcial A Castro-Santiago in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY to Count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
